intro: Herpestis callitrichoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant features opposite, narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its small, tubular flowers are typically greenish-white and appear in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
